HarValgfrieFelt: All fields must be filled in, except fields marked with (optional).
ValidationMessage.InFuture: The date you chose is in the future.
ValidationMessage.ValidDate: You have filled in a text that is not a date. The date must be written in the format dd.mm.yyyy
ValidationMessage.OlderThan6months: The date you chose is older than 6 months.
ValidationMessage.KanIkkeVære3UkerFraIda: The date cannot be earlier than 3 weeks from today.
ValidationMessage.DuMåVæreIUke22: You can apply at the earliest when you are in the 22nd week of pregnancy.
ValidationMessage.IdagEllerTidligere: The date must be today or earlier.
ValidationMessage.FødselsdatoMåVæreFørOm: The date must be after the date of birth.
ValidationMessage.OmsorgsovertakelseKanI: The date cannot be later than 15 years after the child was born.
HvorforSpørNAVOmDette.Info.Tittel: Why does Nav ask about this?
ArbeidssituasjonSteg.HvaGjelder: What applies to {erAlenesøker, select, true {you} other {{navn}}}?
ArbeidssituasjonSteg.HvaGjelder.Required: You must answer what applies to {erAlenesøker, select, true {you} other {{navn}}} before proceeding.
ArbeidssituasjonSteg.Jobber: Have worked 6 of the last 10 months and have earned more than {minsteInntekt} last year
Arbeidssituasjon.Jobber.Infoboks.UtIfraI: Based on the information you have provided, it appears that {navn} is entitled to parental benefit.
Arbeidssituasjon.Jobber.Infoboks.HarRett: {erAlenesøker, select, true {You} other {{navn}}} will be entitled to parental benefit
Arbeidssituasjon.Infoboks.HarIkkeRettTil: {erAlenesøker, select, true {You are } other {{navn} is}} not entitled to parental benefit
Arbeidssituasjon.Ufør.Infoboks.ErUfør: Since {erAlenesøker, select, true {you} other {{navn}}} are disabled, {erAlenesøker, select, true {you} other {{navn}}} will not be entitled to parental benefit.
Arbeidssituasjon.Ufør.Infoboks.LesMer: On Nav's website, you can read more about the rules that apply if {hvem} are receiving disability benefits.
Arbeidssituasjon.Ingen.Infoboks.ManHarIk: If you have not worked 6 of the last 10 months and have not earned more than {minsteInntekt}, you are not entitled to parental benefit.
Arbeidssituasjon.Ingen.Infoboks.NoenUtbe: Some payments from Nav count as income when Nav assesses whether you are entitled to parental benefit. This applies, for example, to sick pay and unemployment benefit. You can read more about which payments apply on Nav's website.
Arbeidssituasjon.Ingen.Infoboks.Engangss: {erAlenesøker, select, true {You} other {{navn}}} might be entitled to a lump-sum grant instead. You can use Nav's guide for lump-sum grant or parental benefit to learn more.
Arbeidssituasjon.AndreForelder: Has {navn} worked 6 of the last 10 months and earned more than {minsteInntekt} last year?
Arbeidssituasjon.AndreForelder.Required: You must answer if {navn} has worked 6 of the last 10 months and earned more than {minsteInntekt} last year before proceeding.
Arbeidssituasjon.Forelder: Has {fornavnSøker1} worked 6 of the last 10 months and earned more than {minsteInntekt} last year?
Arbeidssituasjon.Forelder.Required: You must answer if you have worked 6 of the last 10 months and earned more than {minsteInntekt} last year before proceeding.
HvorMyeSteg.Lønn: How much do {hvem} earn per month, approximately? (optional)
HvorMyeSteg.ViteMer: Would you like to know more about how much one can receive as a single parent?
HvorMyeSteg.MerDetaljert: A more detailed calculation of how much one can receive in parental benefits can be obtained through the guide How much? (opens in a new tab).
HvorMyeSteg.VilFå: {hvem} will receive around {utregning100} per day if you choose 100% parental benefits or {utregning80} per day with 80%
HvorMyeSteg.KanFå: {hvem} can receive a maximum of {utregning100} per day if you choose 100% parental benefits or {utregning80} per day with 80%
HvorMyeSteg.Utregning: This will be around {utregning100} per month at 100% and {utregning80} per month at 80%.
HvorMyeSteg.NAVDekker: Nav covers up to an annual income of {grunnbeløpet}, which is six times the basic amount in the National Insurance Scheme (opens in a new tab).
HvorMyeSteg.BasertPåInntekt: Based on the monthly income {hvem} has reported an income higher than this, but this is not covered by Nav.
Barnehageplass.KommuneTekstDeg: You do not apply for kindergarten placement at Nav, but in the municipality where you live. The date is used for your own part, to see how many days you potentially stand without parental benefit before the {antallBarn, select, 1 {child} other {children}} starts kindergarten.
Barnehageplass.DatoTekst: Estimated based on the Kindergarten Act. Based on the {antallBarn, select, 1 {child} other {children}} {erAdopsjon, select, true {being taken over the care for} other {{erFødt, select, true {being born} other {is born on due date}}}} {dato}, and that you apply for kindergarten the year the {antallBarn, select, 1 {child} other {children}} turns 1.
Barnehageplass.DatoTittel: You may be entitled to kindergarten from {dato}
Barnehageplass.BarnehageTittel: You can get a kindergarten placement before this date
Barnehageplass.BarnehageTekst: Several municipalities have their own rules that allow you to get kindergarten placement before this date. You must check this on your municipality's website.
FordelingSteg.Infoboks.HvordanFordeleTek: The parental allowance is divided into three parts; one for each of the parents and a joint period. With {prosent}% parental allowance, this period is {uker} weeks{dager, select, 1 { and one day} 2 { and two days} 3 { and three days} 4 { and four days} other{}}. You can choose how the period is to be distributed between you.
FordelingSteg.FordelingTittel: How do you want to distribute the {uker} weeks {dager, select, 1 {and one day} 2 {and two days} 3 {and three days} 4 {and four days} other{}} of the common period?
FordelingSteg.FordelingTittel.Required: You must answer how you want to distribute the joint period before proceeding.
FordelingSteg.FordelingOptionAlt: {erOversiktSteg, select, true {The joint period: } other{}} {uker} weeks to {hvem}
FordelingSteg.FordelingOptions: {erOversiktSteg, select, true {The joint period: } other{}} {uker}{dagerS1, select, 0 {} other {+{dagerS1}}} to {hvem}, {uker2}{dagerS2, select, 0 {} other {+{dagerS2}}} to {hvem2}
FordelingsdetaljerPanel.Infoboks.HvisBar: This is if the {erFlereBarn, select, true {children} other {child}} {erFødt, select, true {was born {dato}} other {is born on due date}} and you take leave continuously from {erMorDelAvSøknaden, select, true {three weeks before the due date} other {the due date} }, the leave can look like this with the distribution you chose:.
FordelingsdetaljerPanel.Infoboks.HvisAdo: If you take over the care of the {antallBarn, select, 1 {child} other {children}} the {dato} and you take leave continuously from the date, the leave can look like this with the distribution you chose:.
HvemPlanleggerSteg.HvemPlanlegger.Requir: You must answer who is planning before proceeding.
HvorLangPeriodeSteg.Infoboks.HvorLangPer: You can choose between {uker100} weeks{dager100, select, 0 {} other { + {dager100} {dager100, select, 1 {day} other {days}}}} and {uker80} weeks{dager80, select, 0 {} other { + {dager80} {dager80, select, 1 {day} other {days}}}} with parental benefit{beggeHarRett, select, true {, and the choice applies to both} other {}}. If {beggeHarRett, select, true {you} other {one}} choose {uker100} weeks, {beggeHarRett, select, true {you} other {one}} will receive 100% parental benefit, while if {beggeHarRett, select, true {you} other {one}} choose {uker80} weeks{dager80, select, 0 {} other { + {dager80} {dager80, select, 1 {day} other {days}}}}, the payment will be reduced to 80%.
HvorLangPeriodeSteg.Infoboks.NårBareEnPa: When only the {hvem} is entitled to parental benefit
HvorLangPeriodeSteg.Infoboks.NårBareMorH: When only the {hvem} is entitled to parental benefit, the {hvem} gets the entire parental benefit period.
There are no requirements for what the {hvem} does when the {hvem2} have parental benefit.
HvorLangPeriodeSteg.Infoboks.KunEnAvFedr: When only one of the fathers receive parental benefit.
HvorLangPeriodeSteg.Infoboks.NårBareEnHa: When only one parent is entitled to parental benefit, that parent can receive the entire period of parental benefit.
HvorLangPeriodeSteg.Infoboks.ManFårEnDel: One part of the parental benefit can be used without any requirements for the other father, and one part can be used when the other father is in an approved activity while you're at home with the child.
HvorLangPeriodeSteg.Infoboks.NårBareFarH: When only the {hvem, select, true {father} other {co-mother}} is entitled to parental benefit, you can get the entire period of parental benefit, except for 9 weeks reserved for the mother around the birth.

As a {hvem}, you have a part of the parental benefit you can use without any requirements to the {erMorHovedsøker, select, true {mother} other {father}}, and a part where it is required that the {erMorHovedsøker, select, true {mother} other {father}} is in approved activity while you are at home with the child.
HvorLangPeriodeSteg.HvorLangPeriode: How long period of parental benefit do you want?
HvorLangPeriodeSteg.HvorLangPeriode.Requ: You must answer how long period of parental benefit you want.
HvorLangPeriodeSteg.100: 100 % payment over {uker100} weeks {dager100, select, 0 {} 1 {+ {dager100} day} other {+ {dager100} days}}
HvorLangPeriodeSteg.80: 80 % payment over {uker80} weeks {dager80, select, 0 {} 1 {+ {dager80} day} other {+ {dager80} days}}
HvorLangPeriodeSteg.Infoboks.SisteDagTit: The last day with parental benefit can be {dato}
HvorLangPeriodeSteg.Infoboks.SisteDagTek: If the {antallBarn, select, 1 {child} other {children}} is born on the due date{kunEnPartSkalHa, select, true {.} other { and if you take leave continuously from {erMorDelAvSøknaden, select, true {three weeks before the due date} other {the due date}}.}}
If the {antallBarn, select, 1 {child} other {children}} is born {dato}{kunEnPartSkalHa, select, true {.} other { and if you take leave continuously from the birth.}}
If you're taking over the care of the child on the {dato} {kunEnPartSkalHa, select, true {.} other { and if you take leave continuously from that date.}}
{uker} of the {uker2} weeks can be used by the {hvem} without requirements for {hvemPart1}.
{uker} of the {uker2} weeks can be used by the {hvem} if {hvemPart1} is in approved activity.
HvorLangPeriodeSteg.Infoboks.Barnehagepl: {måneder, plural, one {# month} other {# months}} and {uker, plural, one {# week} other {# weeks}} before kindergarten start are not covered by parental benefits
All the time between the due date and the start of kindergarten will be covered by parental leave benefits

With kindergarten starting no later than {barnehagestartdato}, you will then have {måneder, plural, one {# month} other {# months}} and {uker, plural, one {# week} other {# weeks}} where the {antallBarn, select, 1 {child} other {children}} potentially has not started in kindergarten, and you have no parental benefits left.

With the start of kindergarten no later than {barnehagestartdato}, you will be able to cover the entire period from term to when the {antallBarn, select, 1 {child} other {children}} starts kindergarten with parental leave benefits and have {uker} weeks of parental leave benefits left over.
OmBarnetSteg.HvorMange: How many children are you expecting?
OmBarnetSteg.HvorMange.Required: You must answer how many children you {erFødsel, select, true {are expecting} other {will be taking care of}} before proceeding.
OmBarnetSteg.Adopsjon.HvorMange: How many children will you be taking over the care for?
OmBarnetSteg.HvaGjelder.Required: You must answer what applies to you before proceeding.
OmBarnetSteg.Fødsel.Infoboks: Since you have chosen birth, we assume that you will have children through surrogacy, where one is the biological father and the other adopts the child as a stepparent.
OmBarnetSteg.Fødsel.Infoboks.DenSomErBio: The biological father of the child can take the entire parental benefit period. The other father can receive parental benefit if he adopts the child as a stepparent, provided there are still days left of the parental benefit period when the adoption is approved.
OmBarnetSteg.Fødsel.Infoboks.LesMer: Read more about this on Nav's pages about parental benefit.
OmBarnetSteg.Adopsjon.ForeldrepengerInfo: You can apply for parental benefit now.
When adopting, you can apply for parental benefit once you have the date of care transfer.
You can start the parental benefit period from the date of the care transfer.
Adopsjon.Overtakelsesdato: When do you take over the care for the {flereBarn, select, true {children} other {child}}?
Adopsjon.Fødselsdato: When was the{flereBarn, select, true {oldest child} other {child}} born?
Fødsel.ErFødt: {antallBarn, select, 1 {Has the child} other {Have the children}} been born?
Fødsel.ErFødt.Required: You must answer if {antallBarn, select, 1 {the child} other {the children}} {antallBarn, select, 1 {has} other {have}} been born before proceeding.
Fødselsdato.Required: You must answer what the date of birth is before proceeding.
Termindato.Required: You must answer what the due date is before proceeding.
Overtakelsesdato.Required: You must answer what the date of care transfer is before proceeding.
ErIkkeFødtPanel.ForeldrepengerInfo: You can apply for parental benefit from {dato}
You can apply for parental benefit from the 22. pregnancy week.

{erFar, select, true {Fathers} other {Co-mothers}} often have leave covered for the first two weeks after birth by their employer. If not, the {hvem} can apply for parental benefit from Nav for these two weeks.
ErIkkeFødtPanel.UnderTreMndTilTerminInfo: You can apply for parental benefit
ErIkkeFødtPanel.UnderTreMndTilTermin: {erAlenesøker, select, true {You} other {{navn}}} can apply for parental benefit now to take leave three weeks before the due date.
ErFødtPanel.Fødselsdato: When was {antallBarn, select, 1 {the child} other {the oldest child}} born?
ErFødtPanel.Født.InfoboksTittel: If you haven't applied for parental benefit yet, you can do it now.
ErFødtPanel.Født.Infoboks.ManKanSøkeTilb: You can apply for parental benefit up to three months back in time.
ErFødtPanel.Født.InfoboksTekst.NAVanbefa: Nav recommends applying about four weeks before you plan to start the leave{erMorDelAvSøknaden, select, true {, which is often three weeks before the due date for mothers.} other {.}}
ErFødtPanel.Født.InfoboksTekst.toFørsteU: {erFar, select, true {Fathers} other {Co-mothers}} often have leave covered for the first two weeks after birth by their employer. If not, the {erFar, select, true {father} other {co-mother}} can apply for parental benefit from Nav for these two weeks.
ErFødtPanel.Født.InfoboksTittel.EldreEnn: Since the child is older than three years you cannot apply for parental benefit
ErFødtPanel.Født.InfoboksTekst.EldreEnnT: Parental benefit must be used before the child turns 3 years old.
OmPlanleggerenSteg.Ingress: The planner is for those who are on leave, expecting a child, and for those planning to have children.
OmPlanleggerenSteg.Underoverskrift: The planner consists of two parts:
OmPlanleggerenSteg.Trinn2: Then you can see what your parental leave might look like
OmPlanleggerenSteg.TaVarePå: By copying the link, you can save the result for later viewing or sharing. What you have entered will then be visible to the person you share it with
PlanleggerForside.Label: Approx. 5 min
OppsummeringSteg.Infoboks.IngenHarRettDe: You do not have the right to parental benefit
OppsummeringSteg.Infoboks.IngenHarRett: None of you have the right to parental benefit
OppsummeringSteg.Infoboks.BasertPåSvaren: Based on the answers {erAleneforsørger, select, true {your answers indicate you do not have} other {your answers indicate none of you have}} the right to parental benefit.
OppsummeringSteg.Infoboks.Engangsstønad: Mother may have a right to a lump-sum grant, which is a one-time payment. She can find out in
the guide “Parental benefit or lump-sum grant”
OppsummeringSteg.DereValgte: You chose {prosent} % over {antallUker} weeks with the distribution of the joint period with {uker} weeks {dager, select, 0 {} other {and {dager} days }}for {hvem} and {uker2} weeks {dager, select, 0 {} other {and {dager} days }}for {hvem2}.
OppsummeringSteg.DereValgteFedreEllerAle: You chose {prosent} % for {antallUker} weeks{antallDager, select, 0 {} 1 { + {antallDager} day } other { + {antallDager} days }}.
OppsummeringSteg.DereValgteAktivitetskra: You chose {prosent} % for {antallUker} weeks, where {uker1} weeks are without activity requirements for {hvem} and {uker2} weeks is with activity requirements.

OppgittInformasjon.LengdeOgFordeling: Length {kunEnPartSkalHa, select, true {} other { and distribution}}

You chose {prosent} % parental benefit over {uker} weeks.
HvorMyeOppsummering.DuVilFå: {erAlenesøker, select, true {You} other {{hvem}}} will receive around {utbetaling100} per day if you choose 100% parental benefits or {utbetaling80} per day with 80%.
HvorMyeOppsummering.DetteBlir: This will be around {utbetaling100} per month at 100% and {utbetaling80} per month at 80%.
HvorMyeOppsummering.DetteErBasertPå: This is based on {erAlenesøker, select, true {you} other {{hvem}}} earning around {inntekt} per month.
HvorMyeOppsummering.NAVDekker: Nav covers up to an annual income of {maksInntekt}, which is six times the basic amount in the National Insurance Scheme (opens in a new tab).
HvorMyeOppsummering.BasertPå: Based on the monthly income, {erAlenesøker, select, true {you} other {{hvem}}} has reported an income higher than this, but it is not covered by Nav.
BarnehageplassOppsummering.KanHaPlass: You may have the right to a daycare spot on {barnehagestartdato}
BarnehageplassOppsummering.Beregnet: Estimated based on the Kindergarten Act. Based on the {antallBarn, select, 1 {child} other {children}} {erAdopsjon, select, true {being taken over the care for} other {{erFødt, select, true {being born} other {is born on due date}}}} {familiehendelsesdato}, and that you apply for kindergarten the year the {antallBarn, select, 1 {child} other {children}} turns 1.
BarnehageplassOppsummering.ManKanFå: You can get a daycare spot before this
BarnehageplassOppsummering.Kommune: Several municipalities have their own rules that allow for a place in kindergarten before the date. You must check your municipality's website.
OversiktSteg.100: 100 % for {uker} weeks {dager, select, 0 {} 1 {+ {dager} day} other {+ {dager} days}}
OversiktSteg.80: 80 % for {uker} weeks {dager, select, 0 {} 1 {+ {dager} day} other {+ {dager} days}}
OversiktSteg.Infoboks.FarOgFar.DereHarOp: You have indicated that only one of you is entitled to parental benefit.
OversiktSteg.Infoboks.FarOgFar.DenSomErB: The one who is the biological father can have parental benefit from birth, while the one who adopts the child as a stepparent must wait until the adoption is approved before having parental benefit.
OversiktSteg.Infoboks.FarOgFar.HvisDetEr: If only the one who is adopting the child as a stepparent is to receive parental benefit, you will be entitled to 40 weeks instead of 46 weeks at 100% and 56 weeks at 80% parental benefit.
OversiktSteg.Infoboks.Utkast.Tekst: Here is a draft of what the leave of absence might look like. You can customize this plan according to your own needs, to test out what is possible. Then you can change the periods or add vacation.
UforutsetteEndringer.UforutsetteEndringe: If you become sick during their period with parental benefit
If one becomes sick when receiving parental benefit
The other parent can take over the period with parental benefit when one is sick. The parent who is sick usually receives sickness benefit instead of parental benefit.
If you are too sick to take care of the child, you can usually receive sickness benefit instead of parental benefit during the period of illness.
If the mother becomes sick in the first six weeks of parental benefit

The first six weeks after birth are reserved for the mother, and it is generally not possible to move them to a later date. The exception is if the mother becomes sick and cannot care for the {antallBarn, select, 1 {child} other {children}}. Then the {hvem} can take over the period.

The first six weeks after birth are reserved for the mother, and it is generally not possible to move them to a later date. The exception is if the mother becomes sick and cannot care for the {antallBarn, select, 1 {child} other {children}}.
If you have a new child before three years have passed
If you have a new child before three years have passed, you must use up the parental benefit before starting with parental benefit for the next child.
OmÅTilpassePlanen.Tekst: There's a lot you can change in the plan. When applying for parental benefit, you will set up your own plan for your holiday and other needs.
OmÅTilpassePlanen.FørTermin.Tekst: {erAlenesøker, select, true {You have} other {The mother has}} three weeks that can only be used before birth. If {erAlenesøker, select, true {you give} other {the mother gives}} birth before the due date, {erAlenesøker, select, true {you} other {she}} starts using weeks from {erAlenesøker, select, true {your} other {her}} quota. The remaining part of these three weeks is erased. If {erAlenesøker, select, true {you give} other {the mother gives}} birth after the due date, the joint period is being used until birth when the {erAlenesøker, select, true {you start} other {the mother starts}} on her quota.
OmÅTilpassePlanen.DeFørsteSeksUkene.Teks: The first six weeks after birth are reserved for the mother and locked to this time. Often the {hvem}s have leave covered for the first two weeks after birth by their employer. If not, the {hvem} can use parental benefit in these two weeks.
The first six weeks after birth are reserved for the mother and locked to this time.
OmÅTilpassePlanen.LeggeTilFerie.Tekst: If {erAlenesøker, select, true {you're not} other {neither of the parents are}} taking parental benefit, you can add periods without parental benefit, where you, for example, receive holiday pay from the employer.
OmÅTilpassePlanen.JobbeSamtidig.Tekst: You can work part-time while receiving partial parental benefit, and the period with parental benefit will then last longer.
OmÅTilpassePlanen.PermisjonSamtidig.Teks: Both parents can be at home simultaneously with up to 150 % parental benefit. {erAdopsjon, select, true {This is possible} other {This is possible from week 7 after birth,}} if one parent uses the joint period while the other uses their own quota.
OmÅTilpassePlanen.ToUkerRundtFødsel.Teks: Often {hvem}s have leave covered for the first two weeks after birth by their employer. If not, the {hvem} can use parental benefit in these two weeks.
OmÅTilpassePlanen.LeggeTilFerie.TekstFar: If the {hvem} is not taking parental benefit, you can add a period without parental benefit, where one, for example, receives holiday pay from the employer.
OmÅTilpassePlanen.Barnehageplass.Tekst: The calendar shows the last possible day you can be entitled to a spot in kindergarten, but it may happen that you get a spot before this.
HvaErMulig.Tittel: What is possible when one adapts?
HvaErMulig.MyeManKanEndre: There is a lot that can be changed in the plan.
HvaErMulig.TreUkerFørTermin: Three weeks before due date: Mother has three weeks that can only be used before the birth. They can be used from six weeks before the due date until the due date. If one gives birth before the due date, the remaining three weeks are canceled, and the time leading up to the original due date is taken from the mother's quota. If one gives birth after the due date, one will start using the shared period until the birth.
HvaErMulig.TreUkerFørTermin.Alenemor: Three weeks before due date: You have three weeks that can only be used before the birth. If you give birth before the due date, the remaining part of these three weeks is erased. If you give birth after the due date, you will use more of you period is being used until birth.
HvaErMulig.SeksUkerEtterFødsel.DeFørsteU: The first six weeks after birth are reserved for the mother and locked to this time.
HvaErMulig.SeksUkerEtterFødsel.OfteFårFe: Often, {erFar, select, true {fathers} other {mothers}} get leave covered for the first two weeks after birth by their employer. If one does not get this {hvem} to use parental leave benefits in these two weeks.
HvaErMulig.HvisIngenSkalHa: If {erAlenesøker, select, true {you're not} other {neither parent is}} going to receive parental benefits, {erAlenesøker, select, true {you} other {one}} can add periods without parental benefits, where, for example, {erAlenesøker, select, true {you} other {one}} receives holiday pay from the employer.
HvaErMulig.HvisIngenSkalHa.Far: If the {hvem} is not going to receive parental benefits, one can add periods without parental benefits, where, for example, one receives holiday pay from the employer.
HvaErMulig.MorIAktivitet: The {hvem} must be active, which means {erMorHovedsøker, select, true {she} other {he}} must, for example, work or study. This must be documented during this period.
HvaErMulig.ManKanJobbeSamtidig: You can work part-time while receiving parental benefits partially, the period with parental benefits will then last longer.
HvaErMulig.ManKanVæreHjemmeSamtidig: You can be at home while receiving up to 150% parental benefits. This is possible from week 7 after birth, if one parent uses the shared period while the other uses their individual quota.
TilpassPlanenSteg.FjernAlt.Modal.Tittel: Do you want to remove everything from the plan?
TilpassPlanenSteg.FjernAlt.Modal.Body: Are you sure you want to remove everything from the plan?
Validering.ValidNumber: You have written something that is not a number. Letters, spaces, periods, and commas are not allowed.
SøkOmForeldrepenger.BasertPå: Estimated on the {erAdopsjon, select, true {date for taking over the care} other {{erFødt, select, true {date of birth} other {due date}}}} you can now apply for parental benefit.
